snippet: Prosecutors say Mr. Holmes carried out the massacre at the Aurora theater after his academic dreams crumbled. Defense lawyers argue he had a psychotic break.
abstract: Prosecutors in murder trial for James E Holmes, accused of killing 12 people and injuring 70 others during 2012 movie theater rampage in Aurora, Colo, call witnesses from Holmes's time as graduate student at University of Colorado; witnesses paint image of Holmes as intelligent student who foundered academically in months leading up to shooting.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors say Mr. Holmes carried out the massacre at the Aurora theater after his academic dreams crumbled. Defense lawyers argue he had a psychotic break.

headline.main: At Murder Trial for James Holmes, Conflicting Views of the Colorado Student
headline.print_headline: Gunman’s Life Crumbled Before Carnage at Theater, Colorado Jury Is Told
